sen.j: 駿府（すんぷ）は、駿河国の国府が置かれた都市で駿河国の府中のことである。
sen.e: Sunpu was the city in which kokufu (ancient provincial capital) of Suruga Province was located and fuchu (provincial city which consists of local governments as the core of the city) of Suruga Province.

sen.j: 律令制時代に駿河国の国衙が置かれ、駿河国の中心地となる。
sen.e: Kokuga (provincial government offices) of Suruga Province was located in the age of ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) and was the center of Suruga Province.

sen.j: 室町時代から戦国時代 (日本)にかけて、今川氏の城下町として栄えた。
sen.e: From Muromachi Period to Sengoku Period (period of warring states)(Japan), it was flourished as the castle town of the Imagawa clan.

sen.j: 今川氏は京の都を模して駿府の街造りを行ったため、現在でも地名や町名などに京都と同じ地名や町名が残る。
sen.e: As the Imagawa clan constructed the town of Sunpu by copying Kyoto, there still remain same names of places and towns same as those in Kyoto.
As the Imagawa clan constructed the town of Sunpu by copying Kyoto, there still remain same names of places and towns that are also seen in Kyoto.

sen.j: また、荒廃した京の都を逃れた多数の公家や文化人が駿府に居を移した。
sen.e: Many nobles and men of culture escaped from devastated capital Kyoto and moved to Sunpu.

sen.j: 「東（国）の京」或いは「東（国）の都」と呼ばれ、戦国三大文化の一つ、今川文化が栄えた。
sen.e: It was called "Kyo in the east" or "capital in the east" and Imagawa culture, one of three cultures in the Sengoku Period, was flourished there.

sen.j: しかし、1560年、桶狭間の戦いで今川義元が討死すると、今川氏は衰退し、武田信玄の駿河攻略によって、駿府は焼討ちに遭い一時荒廃した。
sen.e: After Yoshimoto IMAGAWA died in war in the battle of Okehazama in 1560, however, Sunpu was burnt and devastated for a certain time period by invasion by Shingen TAKEDA into Suruga.

sen.j: しかし、今川氏の人質として幼少時代を駿府で過ごした徳川家康が、1585年に駿府を本拠地にし、城下の整備に尽くしたため、元の活気をとり戻した。
sen.e: However, as Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, who spent his childhood in Sunpu as a hostage for the Imagawa clan, decided in 1585 to make Sunpu as his stronghold and made efforts to develop the castle town, Sunpu recovered its vigor.

sen.j: 江戸幕府を開いた家康が隠居すると、再び駿府城に居住して大御所が展開された。
sen.e: Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, who established the Edo bakufu, lived in Sunpu after his retirement and operated ogosho (bakufu ruled by the retired Shogun).

sen.e: In Sunpu at that time, town blocks called "96 towns in Sunpu" were developed and it became a big city comparable to Kamigata and Edo.

sen.j: 一時期、駿府藩が設置された時期があるが、駿河大納言徳川忠長の改易以後は藩は廃止され、幕府の直轄都市として駿府城代・駿府町奉行が置かれた。
sen.e: Although the domain of Sunpu was established and maintained for a certain time period, the domain was abolished after kaieki (sudden dismissal and deprivation of position, privileges and properties) of Tadanaga TOKUGAWA, Suruga Dainagon, and Sunpu Jodai (keeper of castle) and Sunpu machibugyo (town magistrate of Sunpu) were posted as a city under direct control of the bakufu.

sen.j: 東海道が整備されると、駿府城下には、江戸から数えて十九番の宿場、府中宿が置かれた。
sen.e: When Tokaido was developed, Fuchu-juku stage was placed in the castle town of Sunpu as the nineteenth stage from Edo.

sen.j: 江戸幕府が滅ぶと、駿府は「静岡」と改名され、徳川将軍家が当地に移されて静岡藩が設置され、1871年の廃藩置県まで存続した。
sen.e: After the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) was overthrown, Sunpu was renamed to "Shizuoka" and the Tokugawa Shogun family was moved to this place and Shizuoka Domain was set up and continued to exist until Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures) in 1871.
